dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4829 IH: ROAD Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Butterfield (for himself, Mr. Jones, Mr. Price of North Carolina, Mr. Coble, Mr. McIntyre, Mr. Meadows, and Mrs. Ellmers) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991 with respect to high priority corridors on the National Highway System, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Route to Opportunity And Development Act of 2014 or the ROAD Act of 2014.

section.header: High priority corridors on National Highway System

subsection.text: Section 1105(c) of the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991 is amended by striking paragraph (13) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: Raleigh-Norfolk Corridor from Raleigh, North Carolina, through Rocky Mount, Williamston, and Elizabeth City, North Carolina, to Norfolk, Virginia.

subsection.header: Inclusion of certain route segments on interstate system
subsection.text: Section 1105(e)(5)(A) of the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991 is amended by inserting subsection (c)(13), after subsection (c)(9),.
